remarks: A set with a neighborhood is a subset of the topology's base set.  (This theorem depends on a function's value being empty outside of its domain, but it will make later theorems simpler to state.)  (Contributed by NM, 12-Feb-2007.)
statement:
neifval.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
neiss2 $p |- ( ( J e. Top /\ N e. ( ( nei ` J ) ` S ) ) -> S C_ X ) $.
